stmt.origin: sylbi(w0, wcel(c0, cst), wa(wcel(cv(s1), cdif(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(cno, cv(s1)), nat1)))

body.origin:

⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈ States)
⊣ (w0 ↔(s1 ∈(c1 \ c2)∧(normh ` s1)= 1))

stmt.origin: sylan(wcel(cv(s1), cdif(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(cno, cv(s1)), nat1), wcel(c0, cst), wcel(cv(s1), chba))
stmt.pretty: sylan(s1 ∈(c1 \ c2), (normh ` s1)= 1, c0 ∈ States, s1 ∈ ~H)

-| wi(wcel(cv(s1), c1), wcel(cv(s1), chba))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(cv(s1), c1), wcel(cv(s1), chba))
-| wcel(c1, cch)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cst))

⊣ d(s0, w0)
⊣ (w0 ↔(s1 ∈(c1 \ c2)∧(normh ` s1)= 1))
⊣ ((s1 ∈ ~H ∧(normh ` s1)= 1)→ c0 ∈ States)
⊣ c1 ∈ CH

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(cv(s1), chba), wceq(cfv(cno, cv(s1)), nat1)), wcel(c0, cst))
-| wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, cch, co(cfv(cno, cfv(cfv(cpjh, cv(s0)), cv(s1))), cexp, nat2)))
-| diffss(s1, s0)
body.pretty:
⊢ ((s1 ∈ ~H ∧(normh ` s1)= 1)→ c0 ∈ States)
⊣ c0 =(s0 ∈ CH ↦((normh `((projh ` s0)` s1))[^]2))
⊣ d(s1, s0)

|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cst))

-| diffss(s0, s1)

comment: Lemma for strong state theorem: the function ` S ` , that maps a closed subspace to the square of the norm of its projection onto a unit vector, is a state. This lemma restates the hypotheses in a more convenient form to work with. (Contributed by NM, 28-Oct-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)
